meanings.definition: To make something or someone appear more attractive or exciting than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The movie glamorized the life of the main character, making it seem like a fairy tale.
meanings.sent2: The magazine cover glamorized the celebrity, making her look flawless.
meanings.sent3: The advertisement glamorized the ordinary product, turning it into a must-have item.
meanings.sent4: Her Instagram feed glamorized her daily routine, making it seem like a glamorous lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The TV show glamorized the city, showcasing only its most beautiful aspects.

meanings.definition: To portray something in a way that makes it seem more appealing or desirable.
meanings.sent1: The artist glamorized the landscape, capturing its beauty in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent glamorized the house, highlighting its spacious rooms and modern amenities.
meanings.sent3: The chef glamorized the dessert, adding edible gold flakes for an extravagant touch.
meanings.sent4: The author glamorized the protagonist, making readers admire her strength and resilience.
meanings.sent5: The fashion designer glamorized the outfit, using luxurious fabrics and intricate details.
